Familiar.FlavourText: It is recommended to stay as far from these hostile creatures as possible -with the exception of plague dragons, who have a natural immunity to serpenta venom.
Familiar.Name: Acid-Tongue Serpenta

Familiar.FlavourText: These observers cluster around ancient aquatic ruins. They may change color to blend with their surroundings.
Familiar.Name: Abyss Striker

Familiar.FlavourText: While they appear non-threatening, dragons take care not to let this spectral creature pass through them.
Familiar.Name: Aer Phantom

Familiar.FlavourText: A backwards thinking creature.
Familiar.Name: Agol

Familiar.FlavourText: A slarg must keep its skin moist to stay hydrated and avoid suffocation.
Familiar.Name: Algae-Bottom Slarg

Familiar.FlavourText: Dwelling in the waters of the Crystal Pools has left the scales of this fish translucent and hard as a gemstone.
Familiar.Name: Almandine Sturgeon

Familiar.FlavourText: The happiest fox.
Familiar.Name: Alstroemeria Fox

Familiar.FlavourText: This distinctive moth has deep reds and purples running through its leafy wings. It's difficult to classify as purely flora or fauna.
Familiar.Name: Amaranth Moth

Familiar.FlavourText: Sometimes dragon eats fish. Sometimes fish eats dragon.
Familiar.Name: Amber Gulper

Familiar.FlavourText: These avians are always humming. It's incredibly annoying.
Familiar.Name: Amberwing Waveskimmer

Familiar.FlavourText: Warped by unstable energies, these arcane-infused ursidae lose all sense of reason when angered.
Familiar.Name: Amethyst King

Familiar.FlavourText: The constant electrical charge that permeates the warm air of the arid savanna acts as an energy boost to this already spry creature. Catching one is extremely difficult.
Familiar.Name: Ampelope

Familiar.FlavourText: The most crotchety of fungi. As it ages the outer shell becomes crackled and hard as stone.
Familiar.Name: Ancient Fungus

Familiar.FlavourText: A blessing and a curse, donning this armor will increase one's martial abilities, but also one's taste for battle.
Familiar.Name: Animated Armor

Familiar.FlavourText: This peculiar statue wasn't standing there when you last looked, and it certainly wasn't posed in that way either. Don't turn your back. Don't look away.
Familiar.Name: Animated Statue

Familiar.FlavourText: Nekomata sleep with their eye open. It's as disconcerting as it sounds.
Familiar.Name: Anomalous Nekomata

Familiar.FlavourText: Two heads are better than one, except when they're connected to two stomachs. Food fight!
Familiar.Name: Anomalous Skink

Familiar.FlavourText: Ewwww... gross! Yuck! The upholstery is definitely the wrong color.
Familiar.Name: Antique Chair

Familiar.FlavourText: Feasting a diet of crystal-scaled fish has had a dramatic effect on the plumage of this crane.
Familiar.Name: Apatite Fisher

Familiar.FlavourText: Entourage of the Arcanist. (Starfall Celebration Holiday Familiar 2013.)
Familiar.Name: Arcane Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: This Hippalectryon emits a frigid aura.
Familiar.Name: Arctic Hippalectryon

Familiar.FlavourText: Thousands of years of evolution have granted this bat hardened armor to protect against falling magmatic debris.
Familiar.Name: Armored Duskflapper

Familiar.FlavourText: It is arguable whether the armor makes the owl more or less deadly. Without the armor their flight is nearly silent.
Familiar.Name: Armored Greatowl

Familiar.FlavourText: Adapted to filter feed in the scalding depths of Blacksand Annex. (Colored by PythtechGenetics.)
Familiar.Name: Ashen Bicorn Whale

Familiar.FlavourText: This particular variety of chimera only appears in areas of the Starfall Isles where Beastclans are active, leaving some to wonder if the Clans have a hand in their creation.
Familiar.Name: Ashmane Chimera

Familiar.FlavourText: You'd think that, as a serpent, having hooves would be a detriment. You'd be wrong.
Familiar.Name: Ashscale Ophiotaurus

Familiar.FlavourText: A gnarly, vicious land spider that is more at home on the cooled lava than you are. There is definitely reason for concern.
Familiar.Name: Ashspine Widow

Familiar.FlavourText: Dryads will attack dragons that attempt to cut or harvest any piece of their grove.
Familiar.Name: Aspen Gall Dryad

Familiar.FlavourText: Keeping an Augite creation in good working order involves semi-regular patching and allowing the creature long stretches of slumber.
Familiar.Name: Augite Protector

Familiar.FlavourText: The autumn dryad is often seen guiding local fauna to burrows or caves so that they are protected from the approaching colds of winter.
Familiar.Name: Autumn Dryad

Familiar.FlavourText: This variety of pangolin is known for a vibrant shift of color, each unique to the individual. (Colored by biskitten.)
Familiar.Name: Aurora Pangolin

Familiar.FlavourText: This shiny arthropod is a deft swimmer; it is quite a treat to see one swirling and twirling down a creek during the waning sunlight of autumn.
Familiar.Name: Autumn Millifae

Familiar.FlavourText: These creatures will conceal themselves among sea grasses, adding a touch of autumn color to underwater fields of green.
Familiar.Name: Autumn Sea Dragon

Familiar.FlavourText: Sure, 'collector's item' you might say. Might we suggest an axe that doesn't have teeth and eyeballs?
Familiar.Name: Axe Mimic

Familiar.FlavourText: Baku are able to walk both the physical and ethereal plane.
Familiar.Name: Baku

Familiar.FlavourText: A delightful, enchanted Bogsneak marionette. No strings attached!
Familiar.Name: Ball-Jointed Bogsneak

Familiar.FlavourText: Little is known about how the Bamboo Phytocat's physiology evolved, but one thing is for certain: watch the reeds as you walk.. (KS-sponsored by kiohl.)
Familiar.Name: Bamboo Phytocat

Familiar.FlavourText: The banded owlcat moves silently, both in the air and on the ground.
Familiar.Name: Banded Owlcat

Familiar.FlavourText: These animated guardians grow from fallen trees.
Familiar.Name: Barkback Boar

Familiar.FlavourText: Always thrilled to play, this bright canine is the perfect distraction for a lair full of tireless hatchlings. (Colored by Cynderbark.)
Familiar.Name: Barking Jester

Familiar.FlavourText: It's not unheard of for dryads to form alliances with nature dragon clans.
Familiar.Name: Barkskin Watcher

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature with a natural sense of humor, it's not uncommon to see a few Barred Skira trying to blend into a Rambra herd.
Familiar.Name: Barred Skira

Familiar.FlavourText: This springy lizard uses its powerful legs and the reliable burst of hot air from magma vents to quickly traverse lava floes.
Familiar.Name: Basalt Vent Hop

Familiar.FlavourText: A basilisk's gaze can petrify even the hardiest Earth dragons into stone. Staring contests with this familiar are not recommended.
Familiar.Name: Basilisk

Familiar.FlavourText: Never surrender. Never shave. (Colored by Akitaxzero.)
Familiar.Name: Bearded Yeti

Familiar.FlavourText: This species of fish is known for its ability to rapidly change color. Rather than blend in, they seek to intimidate and infatuate their target.
Familiar.Name: Bellus Glamourtail

Familiar.FlavourText: A mix of many rare animals. It can interbreed successfully with species that compose its makeup.
Familiar.Name: Bengal Chimera

Familiar.FlavourText: This dwarf unicorn has lost its magic. Its once shining coat is dull and blackened. The horns of black unicorns are worthless.
Familiar.Name: Black Dwarf Unicorn

Familiar.FlavourText: Forged to infiltrate and dismantle coppercoil creepers. These assassins will perform their work only as long as the coal in their internal furnace burns.
Familiar.Name: Black Iron Creeper

Familiar.FlavourText: A number of Winter Wolves never lose their summer colors. These individuals are uncommon and generally smaller than their snowy-coated brethren.
Familiar.Name: Black Wolf

Familiar.FlavourText: Blackwings are one of the largest species of hummingbird. When in flight, their wings make a distinctive buzzing sound.
Familiar.Name: Black-wing Hummingbird

Familiar.FlavourText: Known for migrating to the warm waters off the coast of Blacksand Annex, Blackline Bicorns compete with the native Ashen Bicorn whales for food. (Colored by Slashfiend.)
Familiar.Name: Blackline Bicorn Whale

Familiar.FlavourText: Raptorik warriors make up for their lack of size with an abundance of ferocity.
Familiar.Name: Blacktalon Striker

Familiar.FlavourText: These creatures spend their early lives swimming in shallow riverbeds. When they mature their fins will have elongated enough to facilitate flight.
Familiar.Name: Blackwing Croaker

Familiar.FlavourText: The eyes of the Flamecaller. (Flameforger's Festival Holiday Familiar 2016.)
Familiar.Name: Blazing Goblin

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon tenacity. It collects blight for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Blight Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: This iridescent beauty becomes even more colorful once it takes flight.
Familiar.Name: Bloodstone Beetle

Familiar.FlavourText: A strangler in bloom is at the end of its life cycle. It is ready to reproduce.
Familiar.Name: Blooming Strangler

Familiar.FlavourText: Where the common Quetzeel is found primarily in the deep seas, the Blotched Quetzeel has strangely made its home in marshes, bogs, and lagoons. Watch where you step!
Familiar.Name: Blotched Quetzeel

Familiar.FlavourText: This cannibalistic snail produces a powerful venom.
Familiar.Name: Blue Dragon Reef Snail

Familiar.FlavourText: Regarded as a top-tier predator of land, sea, and sky, blue tang hippogriffs are at home in any environment.
Familiar.Name: Blue Tang Hippogriff

Familiar.FlavourText: These flowers fend for themselves, uprooting to seek sunlight, shade, and water as required.
Familiar.Name: Blue Vein Pansy

Familiar.FlavourText: Though Serthis are dangerous enough with their unmatched cunning and lightning fast reflexes, they're even more deadly with the right weaponry.
Familiar.Name: Blueband Duelist

Familiar.FlavourText: The bluefin charger hunts on thin ice. It will charge its prey, breaking the ice beneath their feet, sending it to a watery grave. The charger itself is semi-aquatic.
Familiar.Name: Bluefin Charger

Familiar.FlavourText: The static cling is so strong that dragons wearing apparel may end up with several chipskinks affixed to their clothing after wandering through dense brush.
Familiar.Name: Bluelight Chipskink

Familiar.FlavourText: Aviar possess complex vocal chords, enabling them to perfectly mimic the calls of local predators and prey. (KS-sponsored by ZeSethis.)
Familiar.Name: Bluemoon Aviar

Familiar.FlavourText: Salt is the bane of Greatshells; they are only able to survive in fresh water.
Familiar.Name: Blueridge Greatshell

Familiar.FlavourText: Believe it or not, the tint of this mammal's tail is not natural. Bluetail Skira spend much of their day lounging halfway into ponds and lakes where blue algae likes to mingle with their fur.
Familiar.Name: Bluetail Skira

Familiar.FlavourText: A magicked Bogsneak doll that grows an elongated snout in the presence of liars and tricksters.
Familiar.Name: Bogsneak Puppet

Familiar.FlavourText: There's something disconcerting about this bear...
Familiar.Name: Bogus Manamonger

Familiar.FlavourText: Although frightening to look at, bone fiends mostly keep to themselves and the piles of calcified remains that they have collected.
Familiar.Name: Bone Fiend

Familiar.FlavourText: . .. .mysql expects parameter 1 to be string, boolean given. .. (Flight Rising Beta Tester gift)
Familiar.Name: Boolean

Familiar.FlavourText: A favored mount of sprangyroo mercenaries.
Familiar.Name: Boran Veteran

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon strength. It collects boulders for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Boulder Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: A colony of bramble guardians is sure to keep any lair warded from tiny intruders.
Familiar.Name: Bramble Guardian

Familiar.FlavourText: It's not uncommon for these rambunctious canines to get completely distracted by their own beautiful wings. Snap out of it, boy! (Colored by Solarstar.)
Familiar.Name: Brightwing Dwarf Hainu

Familiar.FlavourText: Naturally gifted with a photographic memory and a phosphorescent mane. (KS-Sponsored by Mythka.)
Familiar.Name: Brilliant Psywurm

Familiar.FlavourText: A fastidious and precise familiar. The brown river flight is not capable of true flight, but its powerful wings propel it through the water at great speeds.
Familiar.Name: Brown River Flight

Familiar.FlavourText: These otherwise passive insectoids become enraged if you pick their flowers.
Familiar.Name: Brown-Spotted Mith

Familiar.FlavourText: Brush dodos will stand perfectly still when they encounter a dragon; this remarkable adaptation will ensure the survival of the species.
Familiar.Name: Brush Dodo

Familiar.FlavourText: A lovely little lilypad... that moves... and eats things that land on it... lovely... (Colored by Kizmetto.)
Familiar.Name: Bubble Brook Gecko

Familiar.FlavourText: A creature of uncommon charm. It collects bubbles for its patron.
Familiar.Name: Bubble Nymph

Familiar.FlavourText: Dig, dig as far as you can; the rabbit hole is bottomless.
Familiar.Name: Bucktooth Digger

Familiar.FlavourText: The wings of this mantid never become large enough to facilitate flight.
Familiar.Name: Budwing Morpho

Familiar.FlavourText: Don't tell this cockatrice it missed -and will always miss- leg day. It's plenty buff! (Colored by Whompus.)
Familiar.Name: Buff Laced Cockatrice

Familiar.FlavourText: Buzz buzz, buzz buzz buzz.
Familiar.Name: Bumble

Familiar.FlavourText: This species of caiman got its milky coloration from keeping to dark underground rivers. (Colored by AlpineHell.)
Familiar.Name: Butter Caiman

Familiar.FlavourText: A valuable part of the woodland ecosystem, stranglers will break down organic material rapidly.
Familiar.Name: Buttercup Strangler

Familiar.FlavourText: Hugging this familiar is not the recommended method of bonding.
Familiar.Name: Cactus Marzal

Familiar.FlavourText: A thick, romantic accent and welcoming grin enchant your senses. You feel like a guest here, but can't quite let your guard down.
Familiar.Name: Calculating Candelabra

Familiar.FlavourText: Candy Cockatrice will only develop brilliant colors if fed a steady diet of concentrated sugar. The colorful ones don't live very long... (Colored by Jasp.)
Familiar.Name: Candy Cockatrice

Familiar.FlavourText: Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo, Xolo.
Familiar.Name: Candycane Xolo

Familiar.FlavourText: The brilliant plumage of male cardinal hippogriffs is scrutinized by potential mates.
Familiar.Name: Cardinal Hippogriff

Familiar.FlavourText: The carmine serthis' scales present a particularly rich shade of red after it has freshly molted.
Familiar.Name: Carmine Serthis

Familiar.FlavourText: The dreaded carrioncorn is said to stampede in massive herds throughout the Abiding Boneyard, sometimes locked in vicious battles with resident vultures over rare food sources.
Familiar.Name: Carrioncorn

Familiar.FlavourText: Larger than the average mith, ceanothus miths frequently train to act as the vanguard of their fellows.
Familiar.Name: Ceanothus Brawler

Familiar.FlavourText: Resembles a creature of draconic legend from a distance. Up close it merely looks delicious.
Familiar.Name: Celestial Antelope

Familiar.FlavourText: Asking a centaur archer ’What’s your sign?’ is a sure way to put one on your back that reads ’target’.
Familiar.Name: Centaur Archer

Familiar.FlavourText: With a beard like that, you know he means business.
Familiar.Name: Centaur Berserker

Familiar.FlavourText: These crayfish can live for hundreds of years.
Familiar.Name: Chalcedony Snipper

Familiar.FlavourText: Sprangyroo are commonly hired on as mercenaries by the Longneck clan.
Familiar.Name: Charcoal Sprangyroo

Familiar.FlavourText: I want to be shiiiiinnny!
Familiar.Name: Charoite Burrower

Familiar.FlavourText: So the experiment was not exactly a success...but somehow you cannot bring yourself to dump the results. Is... is it smiling at you?
Familiar.Name: Cheerful Residue
